10000.name: Grey Wolf Cap
10000.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. 
This worn wolf cap was his trademark.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been 
both uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.

Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam,
and renounced his hunter's vows.

11000.name: Charred Hunter Garb
11000.description:
One of the staple articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the 
workshop.
A product of the scourge of the beast that once plagued Old 
Yharnam and culminated in the town's fiery cleansing.
The cape's dampness makes it highly resistant to fire.
Wearers of this attire hunted down victims of the scourge w
ho survived the raging flames and stench of singed blood.

12000.name: Charred Hunter Gloves
12000.description:
One of the staple articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the workshop.
A product of the scourge of the beast that once plagued Old 
Yharnam and culminated in the town's fiery cleansing.
Designed to be highly resistant to fire. Wearers of this attire 
hunted down victims of the scourge who survived the raging 
flames and stench of singed blood.

13000.name: Charred Hunter Trousers
13000.description:
One of the staple articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the 
workshop.
A product of the scourge of the beast that once plagued Old 
Yharnam and culminated in the town's fiery cleansing.
Designed to be highly resistant to fire. Wearers of this attire 
hunted down victims of the scourge who survived the raging 
flames and stench of singed blood.

20000.name: Black Hooded Iron Helm
20000.description:
Iron helmet worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers wear their black hoods low to shadow their
eyes.
This helm is made of metal, a rarity for hunter garb, and has
high defence, but only against physical attacks.

21000.name: Yahar'gul Black Garb
21000.description:
Thick black pullover worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers blend into the night wearing this attire.
Designed primarily to defend from physical attacks, the
binding of thick rope serves both to protect its wearer, and
restrain his foes.

22000.name: Yahar'gul Black Gloves
22000.description:
Thick black gloves worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers blend into the night wearing this attire.
Designed primarily to defend from physical attacks.

23000.name: Yahar'gul Black Trousers
23000.description:
Thick black trousers worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers blend into the night wearing this attire.
Designed primarily to defend from physical attacks.

30000.name: Graveguard Mask
30000.description:
Mask of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
His pale countenance mimics the labyrinth watchers. 
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. Whenthey were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered theeldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the passwordgatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.

31000.name: Graveguard Robe
31000.description:
Robe of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
Countless bloodied ritual tools hang from its back.
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. When they were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered the eldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.

32000.name: Graveguard Manchettes
32000.description:
Manchettes of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
Covered in the blood of untidy rituals.
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. When  they were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered the  eldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the password  gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.

33000.name: Graveguard Kilt
33000.description:
Leggings of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
Covered in the blood of untidy rituals.
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. When they were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered the eldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.

40000.name: Bone Ash Mask
40000.description:
A mask made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers.           
The keepers, who mind the slumbering great Ones, gained
 eternal life, preserved in ashen form in a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul.            
The long, pointed hat is a symbol of the old keepers and is considered evidence of their companionship, forged in a certain sin.

42000.name: Bone Ash Gauntlets
42000.description:
Gauntlets made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers.       
The keepers, who mind the slumbering great Ones, gainedeternal life, preserved in ashen form in  a ceremony of flame  that cremated body and soul.           
Now, their frail armor is white and sinewy, a window into  an arcane lost art.

43000.name: Bone Ash Leggings
43000.description:
Leggings made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers.            
The keepers, who mind the slumbering great Ones, gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form in a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul.           
Now, their frail armor is white and sinewy, a window into an arcane lost art.

50000.name: Henryk's Hunter Cap
50000.description:
Hunter's hat worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.

51000.name: Henryk's Hunter Garb
51000.description:
Hunter's attire worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.

52000.name: Henryk's Hunter Gloves
52000.description:
Hunter's attire worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.

53000.name: Henryk's Hunter Trousers
53000.description:
Hunter's trousers worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.

60000.name: Yharnam Hunter Cap
60000.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.

61000.name: Yharnam Hunter Garb
61000.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary 
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.

62000.name: Yharnam Hunter Trousers
62000.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary 
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.

63000.name: Yharnam Hunter Gloves
63000.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary 
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.

70000.name: Hunter Hat
70000.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the 
workshop.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Recognizable by its withered feathers, this cap is fashioned 
after one of the old hunters.

71000.name: Hunter Garb (Cape)
71000.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the workshop, accompanied with a short cape to wipe away  blood.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.

72000.name: Hunter Gloves
72000.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the 
workshop.
A fine piece of hunter attire the provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.

73000.name: Hunter Trousers
73000.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the 
workshop.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.

80000.name: Knight's Wig
80000.description:
Adornment prized by the knights of Cainhurst.
Resembles a ponytail of silver hair.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast. Theytake great pride even in the blood-stained corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident that they will stand as example of decadent art.

81000.name: Knight's Garb
81000.description:
Attire of the knights of Cainhurst.
A regal piece graced by intricate goldwork.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast. Theytake great pride even in the blood-stained corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident that they will stand as examples of decadent art.

82000.name: Knight's Gloves
82000.description:
Gloves of the knights of Cainhurst.
A regal piece graced with goldwork on red fabric.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast. They take great pride even in the blood-stained corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident that they will stand as examples of decadent art.

83000.name: Knight's Trousers
83000.description:
Attire of the knights of Cainhurst.
A regal piece made with the finest leather.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast.
They take great pride even in the blood-stained
corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident
that they will stand as examples of decadent art.

100000.name: Cainhurst Helmet
100000.description:
Silver helmet worn by the royal guards who protect
Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.

101000.name: Cainhurst Armor
101000.description:
Silver armor worn by the royal guards who protect Annalise,
Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.

102000.name: Cainhurst Gauntlets
102000.description:
Silver gauntlets worn by the royal guards who protect
Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.

103000.name: Cainhurst Leggings
103000.description:
Silver leggings worn by the royal guards who protect 
Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.

110000.name: Black Church Hat
110000.description:
Attire of Healing Church hunters.
Most Healing Church hunters are elementary doctors whounderstand the importance of early prevention of the scourge, achived by disposing of victims, and even potential victims, before signs of sickness manifest themselves.
Their black attire is synonymous with fear, and that peculiar Yharnam madness.

111000.name: Black Church Garb
111000.description:
Attire of Healing Church hunters. The Holy Shawl, symbol ofthe Healing Church, flutters proudly on their backs.
Most Healing Church hunters are elementary doctors whounderstand the importance of early prevention of the scourge, achieved by disposing of victims, and even potentialvictims, before signs of sickness manifest themselves.
Their black attire is synonymous with fear, and that peculiar Yharnam madness.

112000.name: Surgical Long Gloves
112000.description:
White surgical gloves. The intricate embroidery weaves a spell that protects their wearer.
The Church engages in the hunt in a medical capacity. 
When a cancer is discovered, one must pinpoint its location, reach in, and wrench it from the host's bosom.

113000.name: Black Church Trousers/Dress
113000.description:
Attire of Healing Church hunters.
Most Healing Church hunters are elementary doctors who understand the importance of early prevention of the scourge, achived by disposing of victims, and even potential victims, before signs of sickness manifest themselves.
Their black attire is synonymous with fear, and that peculiar Yharnam madness.

120000.name: Blindfold Cap
120000.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking clerics of 
  the Healing Church, and scholars who continue the work
  that began at Byrgenwerth.
The eye covering indicates their debt to the teachings of
  Master Willem, even though their paths diverged.

121000.name: Choir Garb
121000.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.
Together with the left behind Great One, they look to the skies, in search of astral signs, that may lead them to the rediscovery of true greatness.

122000.name: Choir Gloves
122000.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.
Together with the left behind Great One, they look to the skies, in search of astral signs, that may lead them to the rediscovery of true greatness.

123000.name: Choir Trousers
123000.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.
Together with the left behind Great One, they look to the skies, in search of astral signs, that may lead them to the rediscovery of true greatness.

130000.name: Gascoigne's Cap
130000.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
Similar to the hunter garb created at the workshop, only these are tainted by a pungent beastly stench that eats away at Gascoigne.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land, and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.

131000.name: Gascoigne's Garb
131000.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
The Dingy scarf is a Holy Shawl and symbol of the HealingChurch, from which Gascoigne would eventually part ways.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land, and thereis no such rank in the Healing Church.

132000.name: Gascoigne's Gloves
132000.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
Similar to the hunter garb created at the workshop, only these are tainted by a pungent beastly stench that eats away at Gascoigne.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land, and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.

133000.name: Gascoigne's Trousers
133000.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
Similar to the hunter garb created at the workshop, only these are tainted by a pungent beastly stench that eats away at Gascoigne.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land, and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.

140000.name: Tomb Prospector Hood
140000.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.

141000.name: Tomb Prospector Garb
141000.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.

142000.name: Tomb Prospector Gloves
142000.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.

143000.name: Tomb Prospector Trousers
143000.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.

150000.name: Gold Ardeo
150000.description:
The odd helmet worn by the band of executioners
commanded by the martyr Logarius.
The conical gold helmet, symbol of the executioners,
represents luminosity, ambition, and an unflagging resolve to face impurity, staring it down with stern, golden spirit.
As the great Logarius once said, "Act of goodness are not
  always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish, butregardless, we shall always strive to be good."

151000.name: Executioner Garb
151000.description:
Attire worn by the band of executioners commanded by the martyr Logarius.
Later became that basis for all Church attire, with its heavy draping of Holy Shawl.
As the great Logarius once said, "Acts of goodness are not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish, butregardless, we shall always strive to be good."

152000.name: Executioner Gauntlets
152000.description:
Gauntlets worn by the band of executioners commanded by the martyr Logarius.
The brass rivets are unique to the executioners, and reflect their adoration of hand-to-hand combat.
As the great Logarius once said, "Acts of goodness are not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish, but regardless, we shall always strive to be good."

153000.name: Executioner Trousers
153000.description:
Attire worn by the band of executioners commanded by the martyr Logarius.
Later became that basis for all Church attire.
As the great Logarius once said, "Acts of goodness are not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish, but regardless, we shall always strive to be good."

180000.name: Beak Mask
180000.description:
Wood-carved mask of Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters.
The beak contains incense to mask scents of blood and 
beast.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.

181000.name: Crowfeather Garb
181000.description:
Attire worn by Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters,
known in particular for her crowfeather cape.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.

182000.name: Crowfeather Manchettes
182000.description:
Attire worn by Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.

183000.name: Crowfeather Trousers
183000.description:
Attire worn by Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.

190000.name: Mensis Cage
190000.description:
The School of Mensis controls the Unseen Village.
This hexagonal iron cage suggests their strange ways. Thecage is a device that restrains the will of the self, allowingone to see the profane world for what it is.
It also serves as an antenna that facilitates contact with theGreat Ones of the dream.
But to an observer, the iron cage appears to be precisely
what delivered them to their harrowing nightmare.

191000.name: Student Uniform
191000.description:
Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, a bygone institute
learning. This alternative lacks the thick cape.

This Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, and
naturally borrows heavily from its uniform design.

The focus not on knowledge, or thought, but on pure
pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair, ifonly he knew.

193000.name: Student Trousers
193000.description:
Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, a bygone institute  of learning. 
The Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, and  naturally borrows heavily from its uniform design.
The focus not on knowledge, or thought, but on pure 
pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair, if  only he knew.

200000.name: Gehrman's Hunter Cap
200000.description:
Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter.
Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments 
to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all
hunter's garb.
The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and
therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back
to Gehrman's own combat style.

201000.name: Gehrman's Hunter Garb
201000.description:
Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter.
Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments 
to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all
hunter's garb.
The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and
therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back
to Gehrman's own combat style.

203000.name: Gehrman's Hunter Trousers
203000.description:
Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter.
Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments 
to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all
hunter's garb.
The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and
therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back
to Gehrman's own combat style.

210000.name: Madman Hood
210000.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to withstandthe weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
Truth often resembles madness, inaccessible to the dull ofmind. Those who go mad are merely thoughtful souls whofailed to reach any conclusions.

211000.name: Madman Garb
211000.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable towithstand the weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
The appendages draped across them are said to be a kind of protective charm, or at least, that is what these lost souls believe with all their hearts.

212000.name: Madman Manchettes
212000.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to withstandthe weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
Truth often resembles madness, inaccessible to the dull ofmind. Those who go mad are merely thoughtful souls whofailed to reach any conclusions.

213000.name: Madman Leggings
213000.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to withstandthe weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
Truth often resembles madness, inaccessible to the dull ofmind. Those who go mad are merely thoughtful souls whofailed to reach any conclusions.

220000.name: Doll Hat
220000.description:
A discarded doll's hat, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.

221000.name: Doll Clothes
221000.description:
Discarded doll clothing, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine 
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was 
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.

222000.name: Doll Gloves
222000.description:
Discarded doll gloves, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine 
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was 
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.

223000.name: Doll Skirt
223000.description:
Discarded doll skirt, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine 
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was 
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.

230000.name: Black Hood
230000.description:
Hood worn upon awakening to the nightmare of blood and beasts.
Perhaps its wearer had to stay out of sight, 
and travel by cover of darkness.
Without memory, who will ever know?

231000.name: Foreign Garb
231000.description:
Clothing worn upon awakening to the nightmare of blood and beasts.
Not typical clothing of Yharnam, perhaps it is of foreign origin, It is said, after all, the traveller came to Yharnam  from afar.
Without memory, who will ever know?

232000.name: Sullied Bandage
232000.description:
Bandage worn upon awakening to the nightmare of blood and beasts. Terribly worn and unsanitary.
A faint memory recalls blood ministration, involving the transfusion of unknown blood.
Not long after, the nightmare began.

233000.name: Foreign Trousers
233000.description:
Trousers worn upon awakening to the nightmare of blood and beasts.
Not typical clothing perhaps it is of foreign origin. It is said, after all, the traveller came to Yharnam from afar.
Without memory, who will ever know?

241000.name: Ashen Hunter Garb
241000.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. 
Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both
uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.
Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and
renounced his hunter's vows.

242000.name: Ashen Hunter Gloves
242000.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. 
Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both
uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.
Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and
renounced his hunter's vows.

243000.name: Ashen Hunter Trousers
243000.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. 
Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both
uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.
Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and
renounced his hunter's vows.

250000.name: Crown of Illusions
250000.description:
One of the precious secrets of Cainhurst.
The old king's crown is said to reveal illusions,
and expose a mirage that hides a secret.
And so Logarius donned the crown of his own volition,
determined to prevent a single soul from stumbling
upon the vile secret.
What visions did he see, sitting serenely upon his 
new throne?

270000.name: Iron Yahar'gul Helm
270000.description:
Iron helmet worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
Removing the hood reveals something reminiscent of awarrior of a previous age.
This headwear is made of metal, a rarity for hunter garb,
and has high defence, but only against physical attacks.

280000.name: Top Hat
280000.description:
Hat worn by hunters who admire formality.
Some hunters place an emphasis on form, as seen by the use of the threaded cane.
For them, formality, beauty, and justice are the very essence of our humanity, and precisely what keeps hunters from becoming something else.

281000.name: Hunter Garb
281000.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the workshop, accompanied with a short cape to wipe away blood.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.

290000.name: White Church Hat
290000.description:
Attire of special Church doctors.
These doctors are superiors to the black preventative 
hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood 
ministration and the scourge of the beast.
They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but 
rather a method for research, and that some knowledge can 
only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.

291000.name: White Church Garb
291000.description:
Attire of special Church doctors.
These doctors are superiors to the black preventative 
hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood 
ministration and the scourge of the beast.
They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but 
rather a method for research, and that some knowledge canonly be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.

292000.name: Surgical Long Gloves
292000.description:
White surgical gloves. The intricate embroidery weaves a spell that protects their wearer.
The Church engages in the hunt in a medical capacity. 
When a cancer is discovered, one must pinpoint its location, reach in, and wrench it from the host's bosom.

293000.name: White Church Trousers/Dress
293000.description:
Attire of special Church doctors.
These doctors are superiors to the black preventative 
hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood 
ministration and the scourge of the beast.
They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but rather a method for research, and that some knowledge can only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.

301000.name: Student Uniform (Cape)
301000.description:
Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, a bygone institute of learning. Features a thick cape.
The Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, andnaturally borrows heavily from its uniform design.
The focus not on knowledge, or thought, but on pure 
pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair, ifonly he knew.

311000.name: Noble Dress
311000.description:
A finely tailored bordeaux dress.
Worn by the nobles of the old bloodline that traces back tothe forsaken Castle Cainhurst.

313000.name: Arianna's Shoes
313000.description:
Shoes worn by Arianna, woman of the night in the Cathedral Ward.
Innocent and cute, in contrast with its owner.

320000.name: Rumpled Yharnam Hat
320000.description:
Common Yharnam cap.

Well-worn and losing its shape.

321000.name: Sweaty Clothes
321000.description:
Common Yharnam clothing.
Well-worn and damp with sweat.

330000.name: Butcher Mask
330000.description:
Mask of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two. 

The twins grew up in silent kinship with a poisonous snake. 
Eventually they learned human ways, and became hunters. 

When they discovered vermin even in their beloved snake, 
the younger brother is said to have murdered the older.

331000.name: Butcher Garb
331000.description:
Garb of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two.

Both the twins became hunters, and brought back and 
dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in 
their forbidden research.

332000.name: Butcher Gloves
332000.description:
Gloves of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two.

Both the twins became hunters, and brought back and 
dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in
their forbidden research.

333000.name: Butcher Trousers
333000.description:
Trousers of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two.

Both the twins became hunters, and brought back and 
dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in
their forbidden research.

340000.name: Harrowed Hood
340000.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving 
 as a first line of defence against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.

341000.name: Harrowed Garb
341000.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving as a first line of defence against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.

342000.name: Harrowed Gloves
342000.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving as a first line of defence against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.

343000.name: Harrowed Trousers
343000.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving as a first line of defence against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.

350000.name: Old Hunter Cap
350000.description:
Old Hunter Cap with a wide brim that hides their sharp gaze.

In the old days, when hunters were ten a penny, this was 
part of their standard garb.

351000.name: Old Hunter Garb
351000.description:
Old hunter garb.

One day, the hunters disappeared, and Yharnamites began
to whisper of the hunters' sin.

Drunk with blood, chasing after beasts, they would pass on 
to the Nightmare, every last one of them.

352000.name: Old Hunter Gloves
352000.description:
Old hunter gauntlets made of brass to protect their weapon-
bearing hands.

At the time, some hunters believed that certain metals would 
ward off beast blood.
On a night of the hunt, it is no wonder that people would 
resort to superstition.

353000.name: Old Hunter Trousers
353000.description:
Old hunter trousers that protected countless hunters from
the beasts in an older age.

A widespread belief of the period was that "beast blood crept
up the right leg," and this led to the double-wrapped belt.

360000.name: Old Hunter Top Hat
360000.description:
Old hunter top hat, warped by blood stains.

In the old days, when hunters were ten a penny, this was 
part of their standard garb.

370000.name: Maria Hunter Cap
370000.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. This was her hunter's cap, crafted in 
Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great 
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.

371000.name: Maria Hunter Garb
371000.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. This was her hunter's garb, crafted in 
Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.

372000.name: Maria Hunter Gloves
372000.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. These were her hunter's gloves, crafted in 
Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.

373000.name: Maria Hunter Trousers
373000.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. These were her hunter's trousers, crafted in Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.

381000.name: Constable's Garb
381000.description:
Once upon a time, a troupe of foreign constables chased a 
beast all the way to Yharnam, and this is what they wore.
The constables became victims of the beast, except for one 
survivor, who in turn devoured the creature whole, all by 
himself.

The fable is a favourite among Yharnamites, who are partial 
to any stories of pompous, intolerant foreigners who suffer 
for their ignorance. 

It makes the blood taste that much sweeter.

390000.name: Brador's Testimony
390000.description:
The scalp of a horrid cleric beast, indicating that hunter 
Brador, a Healing Church assassin, had killed a compatriot.

Afterward, he wore his ally's own scalp, and hid himself 
away, deep below in a cell. The Church provided him with a 
single, soundless bell of death, to ensure their secrets would 
be kept.

391000.name: Beast Hide Garb
391000.description:
The bloodied hide of a horrible cleric beast, pulled over the 
back. Without the attacked beast hide this foreigner garb 
wouldn't raise anyone's eyebrows.

Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while 
still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide 
were from that day.

392000.name: Bloodied Arm Bands
392000.description:
Bloodied arm bands.

Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while 
still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide 
were from that day.

393000.name: Bloodied Trousers
393000.description:
Bloodied foreign trousers.

Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while 
still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide 
were from that day.

400000.name: Yamamura Hunter Hat
400000.description:
A standard hunter's hat, worn by Yamamura the Wanderer.

This hat and staff were given to him when he became a 
hunter and confederate of the League.

401000.name: Khaki Haori
401000.description:
Garb of a distant Eastern land, worn by Yamamura the 
Wanderer.

This Eastern warrior pursued a beast for honourable 
revenge, then became a hunter of the League. But when he
stared straight into impurity, it drove him mad.

402000.name: Old Hunter Arm Bands
402000.description:
Old Hunter arm bands wound tightly to prevent infection
with the scourge.

Of course, the idea that the scourge was infectious was pure
hearsay.

403000.name: Wine Hakama
403000.description:
Garb of a distant Eastern land, worn by Yamamura the 
Wanderer.

This Eastern warrior pursued a beast for honourable 
revenge, then became a hunter of the League. But when he
stared straight into impurity, it drove him mad.

430000.name: Enlarged Head
430000.description:
An enlarged head of a patient of the Cathedral, with a cavity 
that just happens to fit a human head, although one would 
be mad to try it on. 

But if you do, listen carefully, for the sticky sound. Drip, 
drop. As water, seeping up from the depths, slowly, steadily.
